intro: Cercocarpus ledifolius f. subglaber, commonly known as the smoothleaf bitterbrush, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. The leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and have a smooth, slightly waxy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. This plant plays an important role in providing habitat and forage for wildlife in its native range.
